ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: #1: The reading was really tough, and I'm not sure it added that much.#2/5/7: Jonathan and Tim are both excellent professors - and the course benefits from their combined perspectives. The material is very difficult though.#4: I think a few assignments throughout the semester would be helpful.#6: I think there were the right number of topics covered in the class#10: FES definitely needs this course - it's crucial material for everyone who is studying anything spatial (climate, ecosystems, forestry, wildlife, renewables, land conservation, etc etc etc)
Assignments would have been helpful, but there weren't any.

Textbooks were great. Glad to have free online resources via Yale!The professors both are willing to explain concepts to students. I wish that Tim would be a little more straightforward in his speech, because sometimes his lectures and his responses can be convoluted. He has a great amount of knowledge, and I hope he can convey that more clearly to students.The final project was very valuable for students to apply course material to their own dataset that was selected by them, and is data that interests the students. I really appreciate that we could choose our own dataset. Perhaps we could have benchmarks along the way to monitor our progress through the course? I also really enjoy how we are meant to experiment the techniques learned in the course to find out if they are relevant for our data. Even if certain techniques are perfect for a certain type of data, the process of attempting the techniques is very interesting.
The course would be really valuable for someone with dataset they really wanted to work on because it is more self directed, but it is hard for other people.
The course is project based with no exams and two instructors, so the slightly unusual format may not fit perfectly with the formulaic questions above.
Gaining understanding of these statistical approaches.
The ability to use our own data, and the flexibility to incorporate our projects into the class.
Getting to bring in our own datasets so that we could apply the concepts taught in class.
being able to work exclusively with your own data and not have to worry about making it work for specific problem sets. I really liked the flexibility of the course.
In-class practice in the computer lab.
Applying lecture concepts to our own dataset.
This course covers a really new field of statistics, and it is nice to have an introduction to the field.
Johnathan Reuning-Sherer's teaching style.Learning a completely new software platform

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Maybe add a few homework assignments.

I think this class would really benefit from a lab portion, the class could even be structured completely as a lab where we could follow along with the R or GIS code in the stat lab. That was by far the most helpful day in the course.
It was a bit unorganized--I was unclear on what I should be doing the first few weeks, so it would be helpful to have the syllabus structured from the beginning of the semeseter.

perhaps a few loaner data-sets would be helpful, in case our data is not appropriate for certain methods we're learning. Also, maybe after each topic, we could spend a class in the computer lab going over applications.
Professor Gregoire's lectures are very abstract. I would have appreciated having more concrete examples.
Clearer organization of topics, and clearer presentation of the concepts as opposed to the hard math of it.
Tim Gregoire's teaching style - in one on one interactions Tim is always excellent, he listens and teaches very well, but not so with group teaching I feel.

I wish it had a more consistent assignments throughout the semester, rather than one big project at the end. The concepts and thechniques for this class can be attained much better if we got a practice in small chunks, one after each topic.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: JDRS: Copious and excellent.TGG: I didn't seek out as much help, but when I did, it was excellent and readily available.
Great help from the instructors who were willing to give us lots of time!
excellent and always available.
Both professors were very accessible and excited about the course.
Jonathan is very available and willing to help students. His office hours are a great resource to students. I do wish he were more responsive via email.
The teachers were very available
Both instructors always made a great effort to be available to us, this was where a lot of the best learning experiences came through for me

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This was a great course, and I will absolutely be incorporating it into my thesis work.
This course gave me a very useful tool which I will be able to apply to my dissertation work.

I am a 1st year MPH student, and this course applies to my summer internship goals. I was concurrently taking my 2nd semester of biostatistics. I think that my statistical knowledge should have been betterfor this course. But it was possible to understand the overall concepts without complete understanding of the mathematics.
Spatial statistics probably fits into many programs, and as the field develops it should be really important in many fields.
connects very well with my GIS work and my masters project - wind mapping
The concept covered in class was useful for my master's project.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: The content is central to my Master's project.
I needed a better background in stats and the majority of my data is spatial.
To gain tools in spatial analysis.
I wanted to learn new ways to analyze my data.
Wanted a background in spatial statistics for future work.
To learn spatial analysis to apply to my summer internship and thesis project.
my advisor recommended it.
I thought it was a great way to get started on a part of master's project.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes - I have a basis from which to further explore spatial stats.
yes
Yes.
Yes, I do believe it did.
It did, but I didn't have expectations of learning all of the math, just the concepts
completely outstripped my expectations
I got the right materials, but not enough opportunity to understand the concepts or apply them.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
yes I think this class was very helpful. Again especially since this class allowed us to use our own data.
Yes.
Yes--but I do wish I felt more comfortable applying the concepts on my own. I don't know if I feel prepared to perform the analyses we covered on my own.
yes
yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: no problems asthis worked naturally and allowed us to work with others with our interests.
Really helpful to work on the project with another student in my lab. We worked on analyzing data that will apply to our work at a field site this summer.
Good to collaborate with classmates.I do believe that we could have done a better job spreading the workload out over the semester, but it would have also been nice to have due dates set in place.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do the readings and the more independent coding you do the better. Also take advantage of office hours.
Don't be intimidated by the first lecture and try to follow along with all the R scripts that are posted!
Get a dataset early on and practice with it throughout the class.
Have a dataset you are very seriously working on for a thesis or dissertation that would benefit from a lot of individual attention and work
Don't be daunted by the subject matter, it is a very valuable course and worth the challenge.

You should have a very clear idea ofwhat you want out of the class. Your project should be closely aligned with the class materials, and since there aren't directed assignments, you have to make sure to attain the techniques and concepts by practicing on your own and going to professors for advice.
